Row.Text: Historic Events represent monumental achievements that may occur during a game. These events require planning or user interaction, and are thus a dynamic part of acquiring cultural influence over other civilizations. When one of the following Historic Events is completed, receive a [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism boost with all known Civs based on your recent [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Earn a [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Build a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] World Wonder[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Win a [ICON_WAR] War (Warscore 25+)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Enter a new [ICON_RESEARCH] Era[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Start a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age ('Heritage' Policy only)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Complete an [ICON_RES_ARTIFACTS] Archaeological Dig ('Heritage' Policy only)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Trade with a [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-State ('Cultural Diplomacy' Policy Only)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The amount of Tourism received by these events is based on your culture and tourism per turn over the past few turns. The value of this is also adjusted based on the number of cities in your empire and your tourism modifier with the target civ. Finally, the amount of tourism you receive is also modified by a few social policies and ideological tenets, as well as leader traits, buildings, and the number of cities in your empire.

Resistance is a mechanic through which Civilizations that have conquered one or more Capitals will find it increasingly difficult to capture additional Capitals. During combat, you may see the modifier [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Resistance (Domination)[ENDCOLOR] appear for you (a bonus) or for the enemy (a penalty). This modifier only appears after either you or your opponent have captured an enemy Capital. The modifier changes based on the number of foreign (non-City-State) Capitals owned and the number of foreign Capitals in total. The more Capitals captured by one player, the higher this penalty becomes!

If you choose to raze a City, there is a chance each turn that the City will spawn Partisans loyal to the Civilization you conquered this City from. These units will only spawn if you are still at war with the Civilization. If you are no longer at war, any spawned Partisans will be considered Barbarians. Be careful with aggressively razing enemy Cities, as the sudden appearance of Partisans could turn the tide against you!

Krieg, Krieg ändert sich nie. Nun, eigentlich schon. Im Laufe des Spiels werden sich die Bürger Ihres Reiches immer mehr der Gefahren eines anhaltenden Konflikts bewusst und beginnen,[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Kriegsmüdigkeit[ENDCOLOR] zu entwickeln. Kriegsmüdigkeit wird auf der Grundlage von zwei Faktoren berechnet: der Länge des längsten aktuellen Krieges (wie lang auch immer er sein mag) und der größten Menge an Schaden, den Eure Städte und Armeen in einem einzigen Kampf gegen einen Gegner erlitten haben, den Ihr gerade kämpft. Jede verlorene Stadt oder zerstörte Einheit erhöht Ihre Kriegsmüdigkeit und führt zu drei Haupteffekten:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Unzufriedenheit durch Kriegsmüdigkeit[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Erhöhte Produktions- und Goldkosten für militärische Einheiten[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Reduzierte maximale Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten[NEWLINE]Die letzten beiden Obergrenzen betragen 75%. Achtet darauf, dass Ihr euch während eines einzelnen Konflikts nicht überfordert!

Die maximale Anzahl von Militäreinheiten, die Sie gleichzeitig einsetzen können, wird als Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten bezeichnet. Diese Zahl, die auf oberes Bedienfeld neben dem [ICON_WAR] Symbol angezeigt wird, steigt aufgrund von zwei Faktoren: der Gesamtbevölkerung aller Ihrer Städte und der Anzahl der Gebäude oder angenommener Politiken, die die Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten erhöht hat. Einige Gebäude, wie z.B. die Kaserne, erhöhen Ihre Versorgungsgrenze um einen festen Betrag. Andere, wie Mauern, erhöhen Ihre Versorgungsgrenze um einen Prozentsatz der Stadtbevölkerung[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die durch statische Elemente erhöhte Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten, wie Kasernen, und prozentuale Boni aus der Bevölkerung nehmen mit der Zeit ab, basierend auf dem technologischen Niveau Eures Reiches. Sie werden immer mehr prozentuale Boni benötigen, um dies zu überwinden und große Armeen aufzustellen[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Wenn Sie aus irgendeinem Grund Ihre Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten überschreiten, werden Sie mit 5% Produktion und Nahrung in allen Städten bestraft (pro Einheit über der Grenze).
Ordnet Große Kunstwerke nach möglichen Themen neu. Tauscht keine Großen Kunstwerke mit anderen Zivilisationen und entfernt keine Großen Kunstwerke die bereits zum Handel bereitstehen.
Ordnet Große Kunstwerke nach möglichen Themen neu. Tauscht Große Kunstwerke mit anderen Zivilisationen und kann überschüssige Große Kunstwerke für den Handel freigeben (wenn nötig).
Ihr erhaltet von Ihnen [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR] pro Runde.
Gesamt: {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Wissenschaft (durch [ICON_INFLUENCE] Einfluss über diesen Stadtstaat)

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Diplomatische Ehe:[ENDCOLOR]Euer[ICON_INFLUENCE] Einfluss verfällt nicht, Ihr erhalten +1 Abgeordneten im Weltkongress und +15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Große Persönlichkeiten Rate in Ihrer [ICON_CAPITAL] Hauptstadt.
The great wealth brought back by your {1_UnitType} has led your empire to celebrate 'We Love the King Day' for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turns!

Your {1_UnitType} journeyed to a far-off land and discovered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]! [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Num}[ENDCOLOR] copies of this Resource were given to you in honor of your patronage.

Your {1_UnitType} increased your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in {3_CivShortDesc} by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR], and reduced the Influence of all Major Civilizations known to the City-State by the same amount!

A {1_UnitType} increased {4_OwnerAdj} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in {3_CivShortDesc} by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR], and reduced your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in the City-State by the same amount!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Cannot be selected until you have founded a Religion (or have a majority Religion), or you've reached the Renaissance Era[ENDCOLOR]
{2_ResourceName:textkey} is now available in {1_CityName:textkey}! This increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building pre-Industrial Era Wonders in this city by {3_Num}%!
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Traits
Every [ICON_PUPPET] non-Puppet owned city (excluding [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital) decreases the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism you produce from Cities and Historic Events by {1_Num}% (up to 75%).
{1_Num}% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourismus durch Anzahl von [ICON_PUPPET] nicht-Marionetten Städen

Reduced due to your current wars
Reduced from number of known Techs

Number of Military Units: {2_Num}[NEWLINE]Current Military Supply: {1_Num}[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]War Weariness Supply Cap Reduction: {6_Num}%.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Supply Base Values:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{4_Num} from owned [ICON_CITY_STATE] Cities[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{3_Num} from total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{5_Num} from [ICON_CHECKBOX] Handicap[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Supply Reductions:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{8_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Tech Level[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{7_Num} from [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] War Weariness[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Unit [ICON_PRODUCTION]/[ICON_GOLD] Costs increased by {6_Num}% due to [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] War Weariness.[NEWLINE]
Das Aufbrauchen {@1: gender masculine?der; feminine?der; other?des;} {1_UnitName} erhöht Eure Versorgungsgrenze für militärische Einheiten um {2_Num}!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They have a Defensive Pact with someone![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]We have a Defensive Pact with them![ENDCOLOR]
{1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} may not attempt a coup in {3_CityName} yet because their current Ally has a Sphere of Influence here.
Gesamt: {1_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Nahrung (durch Feitoria).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Diese Werte werden durch Euren Beziehungsstatus mit (Neutral/Freund/Verbündeter) Stadtstaaten beeinflusst.
Total: {1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture (due to [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over this City-State)
{1_CivName} has unlocked {2_Num} more Policies than you.

Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
The number of times you can use the Fleet Repair ability. At zero, the unit is consumed.
Your soldiers found information worth {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science during the conquest of {2_Name}!
You have completed a Policy Branch! Choose a free technology...
You can choose an Ideology! Select your free technology...
You have adopted a Belief! Choose a free technology...

Die Entdeckung von {1_Resource:textkey} veranlasst die Stadt von {2_CityName:textkey} einen "Kaiserlicher Feiertag" einzuleiten. Alle Städte erhalten +1 [ICON_FOOD] Nahrung und +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Kultur.
Entering a new Era has lead to instability and the rise of a new ruling dynasty. Bonus [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Mandate of Heaven are reduced by up to {1_Num} in all Cities.

The creation of a [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Work causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture permanently.

Die Erschließung von {1_Resource:textkey} veranlasst die Stadt von {2_CityName:textkey} einen "Kaiserlicher Feiertag" für {3_Num} Runden einzuleiten und erhöht hierdurch ihre [ICON_FOOD] Nahrung um +{4_Num}%!

The founding of a new City causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

The conquest of a City causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

Die Stadt von {1_CityName:textkey} verlangt nach {2_ResourceName:textkey}! Wenn Sie die Ressource mit Ihrem Handelsnetz verbinden, wird dies die Stadt dazu veralassen einen "Kaiserlicher Feiertag" abzuhalten.
Diese Stadt hält einen "Kaiserlicher Feiertag" ab, der die [ICON_FOOD] Nahrung der Stadt erhöht!
Das Verbinden dieser Ressource mit Eurem Handelsnetz wird diese Stadt dazu veranlassen einen "Kaiserlicher Feiertag" abzuhalten.
Diese Stadt feiert Karneval, der die [ICON_CULTURE] Kulturproduktion und das Wachstum [ICON_FOOD] erhöht sowie die [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unzufriedenheit reduziert!

Das Verbinden dieser Ressource mit Eurem Handelsnetz wird diese Stadt dazu veranlassen Karneval zu feiern, der die [ICON_CULTURE] Kulturproduktion und das Wachstum [ICON_FOOD] erhöht sowie die [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unzufriedenheit reduziert!

If this City-State is more [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]afraid[ENDCOLOR] of you than they are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], you can take exact heavy tribute from them. Doing so will net you [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_PEACE] Faith, or [ICON_FOOD] Food, depending on the City-State being targeted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The amount you can exact in tribute is based on Game Speed and the Yield output of your Capital. Local Yields, like [ICON_FOOD] Food or [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, will be delivered to your Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_FearLevel}{2_FactorDetails}
Because you are burning their city to the ground, partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!
Because your captured city is being burned to the ground, friendly partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]Belief Modifier from 'We Love the King Day:' {1_Num}%

Your musicians were happily received by the {1_PlayerAdj} people. You gain +[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with them, and +{3_num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
{1_PlayerAdj} musicians recently toured your empire, and were warmly received. {1_PlayerAdj} [ICON_TOURISM] Cultural Influence over you has increased by [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR].
Barbarians looted {2_City}, stealing treasures worth {1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they steal more stuff!
Barbarians raided {2_City}, destroying relics worth {1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they break more stuff!
Barbarians assaulted {2_City}, destroying research materials worth {1_Science} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they burn more things!
Barbarians pillaged the stores of {2_City}, taking {1_Food} [ICON_FOOD] Food![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they take more stuff!
Barbarians kidnapped citizens from {2_City}, costing the city {1_Production} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they cause more panic!
Because the City of {1_CityName:textkey} has {2_Population} [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens, a {3_Unit} has been conscripted!
Because you adopted the Conscription policy and {1_CityName:textkey} has more than 8 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens, a {2_Unit} has been conscripted!
A Logging Camp allows you to improve the production output of Jungle hexes.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production provided by this tile, while keeping the Jungle intact.

[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] durch Isolation ([ICON_BLOCKADED] Blockade, [ICON_CONNECTED] Stadtverbindung fehlt oder benötigt [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Handelsweg mit [ICON_CAPITAL] Hauptstadt).
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] durch durch Religöser Unruhe (Benötigen Anhänger der [ICON_RELIGION] Mehrheitsreligion).
{1_Num} Bonus[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] aus Luxusgütern, da die durchschnittliche Stadtgröße {2_Num}[ICON_CITIZEN] beträgt.
[ICON_GOLD] Gold Bedarf Modifikator in allen Städten: {1_num}%
[ICON_CULTURE] Kultur Bedarf Modifikator in allen Städten: {1_num}%
[ICON_RESEARCH] Wissenschaft Bedarf Modifikator in allen Städten: {1_num}%
[ICON_RELIGION] Religion Bedarf Modifikator in allen Städten: {1_num}%
[NEWLINE](Beinhaltet nur die lokale [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Zufriedenheit in dieser Stadt, die durch Gebäude, Politiken und Glaubenssätze gewährt wird.)

[NEWLINE](These 'Needs' are global averages of yields based on the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the City, as well as temporary situations, such as starvation or blockades. Global averages increase as the game progresses, and yields pro citizen decrease as a city grows. The bigger the divide between your city's yields and the global average, the higher your city's unhappiness!)

[NEWLINE](These modifiers are based on a number of factors, such as the size of the City, Technologies researched, Policies chosen, Buildings constructed and/or Civilization traits. Special traits, such as being the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital or a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppet, are highlighted. Positive modifiers raise the global average for this city, whereas negative modifiers reduce it.)
Requires an Ideology to become active.

Due to the birth of {4_UnitName:textkey}, your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital gains:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Great Writer Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num}[ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Artist Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN] Musician Points

Due to the conquest of {4_CityName}, your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital gains:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Great Writer Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num}[ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Artist Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN] Musician Points

Einzigartiges Luxusgut der Brasilianer. Kann nur mit dem Brasilholzlager erschlossen werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Resource tiles.

Brasilholz ist eine tropische Hartholzart, deren Rinde einen intensiven purpurroten und dunkelvioletten Stoff produziert, der zum Färben benutzt wird. Das Holz ist kompakt und wird für die Fertigung von Saiteninstrumenten (insbesondere von Bögen) und Möbeln geschätzt. In der Antike und in der mittelalterlichen Zeit war das aus dem Mittleren Osten nach Europa importierte Holz Caesalpinia Braziliensis und andere Arten von Caesalpinia. Caesalpinia Echinata (auf portugiesisch Pau-Brasil) ist an der brasilianischen Küste heimisch und spielte bei der Namensgebung dieses Landes eine Rolle.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tech unlocks remaining until free Social Policy: {1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]

"The sea calmed and the whirlwind and flood stopped.[NEWLINE]Utnapishtim opened a window and felt fresh air on his face.[NEWLINE]He looked for coastlines at the horizon and saw a region of land.[NEWLINE]The boat lodged firmly on mount Nimush which held the boat for several days, allowing no swaying.[NEWLINE]He released a raven which was able to eat and scratch, and did not circle back to the boat.[NEWLINE]He then sent his livestock out in various directions."
